result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Joshua J. Paff in court with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg.  Defendant Joshua J. Paff in custody.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls 15CF18, 15CF49, 15CF50, 15CF94, and 16CF5 @ 9:02 a.m. Agreement stated 15CF49 Def will plead to ct 1, 15CF50 plead to ct 1, 16CF5 plead to cts 1 & 2.  State will dismiss and read in remaining cts and also 15CF18 and 15CF94 in entirety. 15CF49 ct 1 - 15 days jail consecutive to any other sentence currently serving, 15CF50 ct 1 - 6 months jail, consecutive to all other sentences, 16CF5 cts 1 & 2, withheld sentence, 4 yrs probation. Atty Laufenberg and Def agree. Plea quest reviewed. 15CF49 ct 1 - no contest plea. 15CF50 ct 1 - no contest. 16CF5 cts 1 & 2 - no contest pleas. Court grants motion to dismiss and read in 15CF18 cts 1 & 2 and 15CF49 cts 2-5, 15CF50 cts 2 & 3. 15CF94 State has complied with VWNR, cts 1-7 dismissed and read in. Constitutional rights, elements, possible penalties reviewed. Atty Laufenberg satisfied. Court finds Def understands and pleas freely & voluntarily made. Factual basis. Court accepts pleas and finds Def guilty of 15CF49 ct 1 disorderly conduct, 15CF50 ct 1 throw/discharge bodily fluid at public safety worker, 16CF5 cts 1 & 2, throw/discharge bodily fluid at public safety worker, as repeater. Sentencing remarks by Counsel. Nothing by Defendant. Sentencing remarks by the Court. Statement by Defendant. Court approves agreement. 15CF49 ct 1 - 15 days jail, consecutive to all other sentences, court costs, including DNA surcharge. Any credit for time served will be determined, Court will hold open. Discussion regarding bonds, Court explains to poster. Court orders bonds returned to poster. 15CF50 ct 1 - 6 months jail, consecutive to all other sentences, court costs, including DNA surcharge. No credit ordered, but held open. Eligible for earned release and challenge inc. programs. Def advised of firearms and voting restrictions. 16CF5 ct 1 - sentence withheld, 4 yrs probation, court costs, DNA surcharge. Ct 2 - sentence withheld, 4 yrs probation, concurrent, court costs, DNA surcharge. No credit ordered at this time, but held open. Postconviction rights. 15CF49 & 50 - pp, Def to contact COC as soon as released.

ADDRESS INFO for Joshua J. Paff

Attorney Wright C. Laufenberg in court.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls  15CF49, 15CF18, 15CF94, 15CF50, 16CF5 @ 9:11am. Matter is resolved, pleas will be taken on 3 of the files & joint recommendations. 2 case are being DRI. State will complete Writ. Atty Laufenberg gives statement. No PSI will be ordered. 15CF49 & 15CF18 Bond forfeiture will be heard on plea & sentencing date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 10, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Joshua J. Paff in court with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg.  Defendant Joshua J. Paff in custody.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls 15CF50, 15CF18, 15CF94, 15CF49, 16CF5 @ 11:18 a.m. Def is waiving prelim hrg on 16CF5, status conf. on remaining files. Statement by Atty Laufenberg. Court reviews waiver of prelim with Defendant. Court finds waiver is knowing and voluntary. Information filed. Copy received. Court finds probable cause and binds over. Statement by Atty Laufenberg. Reading waived, not guilty pleas. Court receives pleas and directs entry in record. All files set for status conference.  Def will not be present for status unless resolved.  Status conference scheduled for April 26, 2016 at 09:15 am.

Defendant Joshua J. Paff in court, in custody with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls 16CF5, 15CF49, 15CF50, 15CF18 15CF94 @ 3:58 pm. Atty Laufenberg has not be appointed & appears special appearance copy of new complaint in 16CF5, waives reading.  Court advised def. of charges & penalties. Def. does have copy of new complaint.  State gives bond recommendation, $1000.00 cash bond, Atty Laufenberg reserve argument. Court orders $1,000.00 cash bond. All other files will be set for Status Cnf.  Def. will waive time limits for p.h. Court accepts waiver of time limits.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 24, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Attorney Wright C. Laufenberg in court.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls 15CF18, , 15CF49, 15CF50 & 15CF94  @ 10:24 am.  Def. is in custody & don't need def. here.  Def. is getting revoked on other case.  Atty Laufenberg makes statement.  Status conference scheduled for January 5, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Joshua J. Paff in court with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg.  Defendant Joshua J. Paff in custody.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls 15CF49, 15CF50, 15CF18 and 15CF94 @ 10:32 a.m. 15CF94 - Information received, reading waived, reserve all juris. obj. and enter not guilty pleas to all cts. Court receives pleas and enters on record. Statement by Atty Laufenberg. All cases set for status conf. Bond continued.  Status conference scheduled for December 8, 2015 at 09:15 am.

Defendant Joshua J. Paff in court with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg.  Defendant Joshua J. Paff in custody.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls 15CF94, 15CF18, 15CF49 and 15CF50 @ 11:26 a.m.  15CF94 - preliminary hrg - Ofc. Bruce Brown duly sworn on oath, testifies. Witness identifies Defendant. Exhibit 1 - victim statement from Marshfield Police Dept. Exhibit 1 offered and received. Atty Laufenberg gives arguments opposing bind over. Response by State. Court finds probable cause and binds over. Information filed. Copy received. All other files to track along.  Arraignment scheduled for October 28, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Joshua J. Paff in court via video, with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg.  Defendant Joshua J. Paff in custody.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls 15CF18, 15CF49, 15CF50, 15CF94 @ 10:23 a.m. Statement by Atty Laufenberg. Ask for prelim hrg. on 15CF94, remaining cases to follow with status conf. Bond remains.  Status conference scheduled for August 26, 2015 at 11:15 am.

Defendant Joshua J. Paff in court with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls  @ 3:56 pm.  Misty Servi, City of Antigo Police Dept, duly sworn on oath, testifies. Court finds probable cause & binds over.  Information Filed. Atty Laufenberg has copy of information, waives reading, reserve rights & enters Not Guilty plea.  Court enters Not Guilty plea. Bond continued.  Status conference scheduled for July 22, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Joshua J. Paff in court with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls 15CF18 & 15CF31 @ 3:07 pm.  Atty Laufenberg has copy of complaints, waives reading.  15CF31 State gives bond recommendation $1,000.00 signature bond, no contact with D.V. Court orders $1,000 Signature bond w/condition.  Atty Laufenberg waives time limits for p.h..  Def. agrees in both cases.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 5, 2015 at 03:15 pm.

Defendant Joshua J. Paff in court.  Jill Louise Laufenberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Laufenberg as to the status of case.  Def has copy of complaint.  Def indicates that the felony case in Waupaca county has been dismissed.  State will check into it.  Def request obtaining counsel.  Court will adj.  Bond will continue  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Joshua J. Paff in court via video, in custody.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 11:53 a.m. Copy of complaint will be sent to Def with bond. Charges reviewed. State asks for $500 cash bond. Response by Def. Requests signature bond. State advises Court of charges in Waupaca Co. and other Langlade Co. cases.  Court sets both cash and signature bonds with no additional conditions. Warrant vacated. Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
